intro: Prescottia leptostachya, commonly known as the slender-stalked Prescotia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. This species is characterized by its delicate, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It is a relatively small plant, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, with narrow, grass-like leaves.
